186034436.review:
一直玩的手机盗版，给童年补票了(但还是感觉手机版更好操作，电脑对键鼠和手柄的支持都太差了）
最最最最最最最好玩的载具建造类游戏，从最开始的飞起来转圈，到造出第一架螺旋桨，再到第一次用xml改数据，一步一步创造属于自己的飞机，这种成就感真的太棒了。
可玩性非常高，但上手难度也是玩过的游戏里面最高的。
名字叫简单飞机，当然可以就造一架简简单单的飞机，但如果深究的话，从外形到控制都是有无穷无尽空间的，可以花几千组件去还原一架现实存在的机型，也可以写满密密麻麻的的飞控来让飞不上天的飞机飞得平稳顺畅。
社区也非常不错，每时每刻都有新模型上传。

185916801.review: It is easy to build planes in this game; however, it is a game full of glitches. There are glitches in the controls. There are glitches in the physics. There are glitches in the weapon systems. I'm not sure what's going on. It needs to get a lot of these issues worked out.

185867446.review:
This is a masterpiece of a game, if you have enough braincells to install mods.
Even without mods it still looks relatively good and has a fair amount of good planes, but without mods you're gonna be stuck figuring out how people make realistic fighter jets.

I do recommend this game though, there isn't really anything bad about it except for the water physics. PLEASE ADD WATER PHYSICS IN SIMPLEPLANES 2

185261844.review: 很好的游戏使我戒掉了战地和pubg

184829332.review:
Совсем примитивненько. Да ещё и багами.
Например в миссии Crosswind Landing в самом начале выскочило сообщение что я утонул, хотя я был в воздухе и воду вообще не трогал.
Управление дёрганное и рывками. Оружие переключать не удобно, тут какая то странная система с группами оружия которую надо прокликивать мышкой. Прицела нет от третьего лица.
Есть полно аналогичных игр сделанных гораздо лучше.
В KSP тоже можно крылатые пепелацы строить балансируя их аэродинамику, и даже там управление удобнее.
В War Thunder управление с мышки пропеллерными самолётами второй мировой гораздо комфортнее.
А в Ace Combat 7 стрелять самонаводящимися ракетами гораздо веселее.

184257088.review: So this game is not for everyone. It started as a mobile game a decade ago and the core has not changed much since then. That said, if you're willing to stick with it the game can be a blast. The basic mechanics of building are very simple, but using fuselage and the games built in coding language, Funky Trees, can be a fairly massive skill curve. Beyond that, there is a ton of complexity in building suspension, weapons, screens, and making the vehicle drive well. Some of the most important building features, such as being able to nudge parts around or edit the properties of your parts beyond their preset limitations, are in slightly clunky interfaces originally designed as mods for the game but incorporated in entirety when the developers annexed that modder. These interfaces add abilities that the developers probably would have never tried otherwise, which is probably a good thing since the possibilities for what you can make are pretty much unlimited. Honestly while the systems of the game are rather difficult to use, the ceiling for both what you can make and the skills you can have are pretty much unlimited, resulting in some almost perfect recreations of aircraft, cars, and more from some of the game's top creators. The physics of the in-game world are pretty limited to be honest, they are rather unrealistic and aren't too far removed from Unity 3.1's defaults. That's ok though, because with enough skill and some rather janky placement of invisible thrusters and wings you can make stuff act pretty much however you want. There's multiplayer too, although it is only available as a mod and is a bit janky. That said there is a fairly active segment of the population that plays in the multiplayer servers pretty often, and you can usually find 4 or 5 people playing. The biggest part of this game for most is the community. I started playing this game about three years ago, putting about a hundred hours in on mobile in addition to my 200 on this, and while I feel I have outgrown the community to some extent, I do not regret the fun I had on there. Someone figured out how to upvote unlisted posts with goofy stuff in the backend of the website, and that if you are added to be a contributor on a mod you can upvote that, giving yourself some points, and someone (Korzalerke) had created an unlisted mod to add people to as contributors and use as a secret chatroom. A bunch of people were upvoting it, and that actually resulted in people gaining a not insignificant amount of points as a result. This incident probably doesn't mean much to someone who hasn't participated in the online community, but the good times I've had will not be forgotten as I move on in life.
